page.title: 04PLANTS/ANIMALS IN HODGEMOOR
page.content: Signs of man were carvings on trees, charcoal burners,a bracken camp and fire beaters for putting out fires.We saw grey squirrels and lots of animal signs like feathers,nibbled nuts and pine cones,birds' nests and a squirrel drey right up in a tree.We found some nibbled leaves,marks on and holes in trees and a bird's egg.There were lots of plants like blackberries,bracken, grass and nice soft moss.The honey- suckle smelled lovely.There were clover buttercups,daisies,speedwell and lichen, moss and fungus growing on the trees and on tree stumps.We saw colourful butterflies and lots of different flies, spiders,shield bugs, woodlice,moths, bumble bees and ants. We had a lovely morning in Hodgemoor Woods.
